segments.text: Where did you get your mobile ? It's really cute .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Oh , this ? I got it in Singapore . Here , do you want to take a look ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes , it is , isn't it ? A bit too light , really . What make have you got ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I've got an old Ericsson . Here . Take a look .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Why don't you get a new one ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I don't know . I like this one , and I don't have any need for all the bells and whistles you get on the new ones .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Really , what makes you say that ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Well , I just need to make and receive calls , and it's quite reliable . I find that the more fancy stuff they put into these things , the more likely they are to break bown or go wrong , you know ? I mean , this camera function , for instance-how often do you use it ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Sometimes , but I guess not very often . It's more for fun . Sometimes when I'm on a trip , for example , I can take a picture and send it to my kids . Or I can send a picture of a sample back to my office and get it costed up immediately .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Well , that's nice I guess . So how many kids do you have ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Three . Two boys and a girl .
segments.speaker: S2
